verses.kjv: Blow ye the trumpet in Zion, and sound an alarm in my holy mountain: let all the inhabitants of the land tremble: for the day of the LORD cometh, for it is nigh at hand;
verses.ct: Sound the trumpet in Zion! Raise the alarm on my holy mountain! Let everyone in the land shake with fear, because the day of the LORD is coming — it is near!

verses.kjv: A day of darkness and of gloominess, a day of clouds and of thick darkness, as the morning spread upon the mountains: a great people and a strong; there hath not been ever the like, neither shall be any more after it, even to the years of many generations.
verses.ct: It will be a day of darkness and gloom, a day of clouds and deep shadow. Like dawn spreading across the mountains, a massive and powerful army approaches. Nothing like it has ever existed before, and nothing like it will come again for countless generations.

verses.kjv: A fire devoureth before them; and behind them a flame burneth: the land is as the garden of Eden before them, and behind them a desolate wilderness; yea, and nothing shall escape them.
verses.ct: Fire consumes everything ahead of them, and flames blaze behind them. Before they arrive, the land looks like the garden of Eden, but after they pass through, it becomes an empty wasteland. Nothing escapes them.

verses.kjv: The appearance of them is as the appearance of horses; and as horsemen, so shall they run.
verses.ct: They look like horses, and they charge forward like cavalry.

verses.kjv: Like the noise of chariots on the tops of mountains shall they leap, like the noise of a flame of fire that devoureth the stubble, as a strong people set in battle array.
verses.ct: They leap across mountaintops with a sound like rattling chariots, like the crackling of fire burning through dry stubble — like a mighty army lined up for battle.

verses.kjv: Before their face the people shall be much pained: all faces shall gather blackness.
verses.ct: At the sight of them, nations writhe in agony, and every face turns pale with dread.

verses.kjv: They shall run like mighty men; they shall climb the wall like men of war; and they shall march every one on his ways, and they shall not break their ranks:
verses.ct: They charge like warriors and scale walls like trained soldiers. Each one marches in formation, never breaking ranks.

verses.kjv: Neither shall one thrust another; they shall walk every one in his path: and when they fall upon the sword, they shall not be wounded.
verses.ct: They never crowd each other; each one stays in its own lane. They plunge through defenses without being stopped.

verses.kjv: They shall run to and fro in the city; they shall run upon the wall, they shall climb up upon the houses; they shall enter in at the windows like a thief.
verses.ct: They swarm through the city and rush along the walls. They climb into houses and slip through windows like thieves.

verses.kjv: The earth shall quake before them; the heavens shall tremble: the sun and the moon shall be dark, and the stars shall withdraw their shining:
verses.ct: The earth shakes in front of them, and the heavens tremble. The sun and moon go dark, and the stars stop shining.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall utter his voice before his army: for his camp is very great: for he is strong that executeth his word: for the day of the LORD is great and very terrible; and who can abide it?
verses.ct: The LORD thunders his voice at the head of his army, because his forces are incredibly vast. The one who carries out his command is powerful. The day of the LORD is overwhelming and terrifying — who can endure it?

verses.kjv: Therefore also now, saith the LORD, turn ye even to me with all your heart, and with fasting, and with weeping, and with mourning:
verses.ct: "But even now," declares the LORD, "come back to me with all your heart — with fasting, with weeping, and with mourning."

verses.kjv: And rend your heart, and not your garments, and turn unto the LORD your God: for he is gracious and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repenteth him of the evil.
verses.ct: Tear open your hearts, not your clothes, and return to the LORD your God. He is gracious and compassionate, patient and overflowing with kindness, and he relents from sending disaster.

verses.kjv: Who knoweth if he will return and repent, and leave a blessing behind him; even a meat offering and a drink offering unto the LORD your God?
verses.ct: Who knows? He may turn back and relent, leaving behind a blessing — grain offerings and drink offerings for the LORD your God.

verses.kjv: Blow the trumpet in Zion, sanctify a fast, call a solemn assembly:
verses.ct: Sound the trumpet in Zion! Declare a sacred fast and call everyone to a solemn gathering.

verses.kjv: Gather the people, sanctify the congregation, assemble the elders, gather the children, and those that suck the breasts: let the bridegroom go forth of his chamber, and the bride out of her closet.
verses.ct: Assemble the people, consecrate the congregation, bring together the elders, gather the children — even nursing infants. Let the groom leave his room and the bride her chamber.

verses.kjv: Let the priests, the ministers of the LORD, weep between the porch and the altar, and let them say, Spare thy people, O LORD, and give not thine heritage to reproach, that the heathen should rule over them: wherefore should they say among the people, Where is their God?
verses.ct: Let the priests, the servants of the LORD, weep between the entrance hall and the altar. Let them pray, 'Have mercy on your people, LORD! Don't let your inheritance become an object of scorn, with other nations mocking them. Why should the peoples say, "Where is their God?"'

verses.kjv: Then will the LORD be jealous for his land, and pity his people.
verses.ct: Then the LORD will be fiercely protective of his land and show compassion to his people.

verses.kjv: Yea, the LORD will answer and say unto his people, Behold, I will send you corn, and wine, and oil, and ye shall be satisfied therewith: and I will no more make you a reproach among the heathen:
verses.ct: The LORD will respond and tell his people, 'Look, I am sending you grain, new wine, and olive oil, and you will have plenty. I will never again make you an object of ridicule among the nations.

verses.kjv: But I will remove far off from you the northern army, and will drive him into a land barren and desolate, with his face toward the east sea, and his hinder part toward the utmost sea, and his stink shall come up, and his ill savour shall come up, because he hath done great things.
verses.ct: I will push the northern army far away from you and drive it into a dry and desolate land — its front ranks toward the eastern sea and its rear guard toward the western sea. Its stench will rise, and its foul smell will go up, because it has done terrible things.'

verses.kjv: Fear not, O land; be glad and rejoice: for the LORD will do great things.
verses.ct: Don't be afraid, land of Israel! Be happy and celebrate, because the LORD has done great things.

verses.kjv: Be not afraid, ye beasts of the field: for the pastures of the wilderness do spring, for the tree beareth her fruit, the fig tree and the vine do yield their strength.
verses.ct: Don't be afraid, wild animals, because the open pastures are turning green again. The trees are producing their fruit, and the fig trees and grapevines are yielding their full harvest.

verses.kjv: Be glad then, ye children of Zion, and rejoice in the LORD your God: for he hath given you the former rain moderately, and he will cause to come down for you the rain, the former rain, and the latter rain in the first month.
verses.ct: Celebrate, people of Zion! Rejoice in the LORD your God, because he has given you the autumn rains in just measure. He will send downpours for you — both the autumn rains and the spring rains, as before.

verses.kjv: And the floors shall be full of wheat, and the vats shall overflow with wine and oil.
verses.ct: The threshing floors will be heaped with wheat, and the vats will overflow with new wine and olive oil.

verses.kjv: And I will restore to you the years that the locust hath eaten, the cankerworm, and the caterpiller, and the palmerworm, my great army which I sent among you.
verses.ct: "I will make up for the years that the swarming locusts devoured — the young locusts, the destroying locusts, and the cutting locusts — my massive army that I sent against you.

verses.kjv: And ye shall eat in plenty, and be satisfied, and praise the name of the LORD your God, that hath dealt wondrously with you: and my people shall never be ashamed.
verses.ct: You will eat abundantly and be satisfied, and you will praise the name of the LORD your God, who has done amazing things for you. My people will never be put to shame again.

verses.kjv: And ye shall know that I am in the midst of Israel, and that I am the LORD your God, and none else: and my people shall never be ashamed.
verses.ct: Then you will know that I am present among Israel, that I am the LORD your God and there is no other. My people will never be put to shame again."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass afterward, that I will pour out my spirit upon all flesh; and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, your old men shall dream dreams, your young men shall see visions:
verses.ct: After this, I will pour out my spirit on all people. Your sons and daughters will prophesy, your old men will have dreams, and your young men will see visions.

verses.kjv: And also upon the servants and upon the handmaids in those days will I pour out my spirit.
verses.ct: Even on male and female servants I will pour out my spirit in those days.

verses.kjv: And I will shew wonders in the heavens and in the earth, blood, and fire, and pillars of smoke.
verses.ct: I will display wonders in the heavens and on the earth — blood, fire, and columns of smoke.

verses.kjv: The sun shall be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before the great and the terrible day of the LORD come.
verses.ct: The sun will turn to darkness and the moon to blood before the great and terrifying day of the LORD arrives.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that whosoever shall call on the name of the LORD shall be delivered: for in mount Zion and in Jerusalem shall be deliverance, as the LORD hath said, and in the remnant whom the LORD shall call.
verses.ct: Everyone who calls on the name of the LORD will be rescued. On Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there will be deliverance, just as the LORD has promised, among the survivors whom the LORD calls.
